libvirt plugin: Fix the HostnameFormat option.

The attached patch fixes HostnameFormat in libvirt driver.

The intended use for this was:

   HostnameFormat "name"

generating hostnames like "<guestname>" (the default case), and:

   HostnameFormat "hostname name"

generating hostnames like "<hostname>:<guestname>".

Somewhere along the way, however, that code got broken so it always adds a ":"
before the name, and doesn't concatenate any more, so you'd get weird hostnames
appearing like ":guest" which was supposed to be "hostname:guest".

The patch just reverts back to my original code.

Rich.

bindings/Makefile.am: Replaced "make -C" with "cd && make".

BSD make does not support "make -C".

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

bindings/Makefile.am: Removed a bashism.

Brace expansion using { and } is not defined by POSIX but rather a bash
extension and should thus not be used for portability reasons.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

collectd.conf(5): Added a note about the availability of the "debug" loglevel.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>
Merge branch 'collectd-4.2'
collectd.conf(5): Fix a messed up merge.
Merge branch 'collectd-4.2'

Merge branch 'collectd-4.1' into collectd-4.2

Conflicts:

	src/collectd.conf.pod
collectd.conf(5): Documented the fact that the configuration is processes from top to bottom.
collectd.conf(5): Added a note about plugin loading order.
src/configfile.c: Improve the "Plugin `%s' did not register a callback." warning.

unixsock plugin: Actually set the permissions for the socket.

Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>
src/utils_cache.c: Call `ut_check_interesting' before sending OKAY notifications, too.
exec plugin: The execution of notification handling programs seems to work now.
src/utils_{cache,threshold}.c: Adapted to the new AVL interface.

Merge branch 'collectd-4.2'

Conflicts:

	bindings/Makefile.am
Bumped version to 4.2.3; Updated ChangeLog.
build system: Yet another way to solve the src-dir vs. build-dir issue.

configure.in: Copy sources of the Perl bindings to the build directory.

As the Perl build system around ExtUtils::MakeMaker doesn't know how to
separate source and build directories, all relevant source files have to be
available in the build directory.

This is an alternative patch for the problem reported by Michael Tiernan.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

Revert "bindings/Makefile.am: Fix a bug that happened when src and build directory are not the same."

This reverts commit 61f5c1a972626212aab60c4d50f45097485b8e51 which had the
following problems:

 * parts of the build process took place in the source directory (which should
   be read-only though)

 * the "perl" target should not be renamed - the name is used in
   @PERL_BINDINGS@ to identify the bindings that are supposed to be built

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

utils_mount.c: Fixed an unused variable warning on some systems.

This warning appeared on systems using listmntent() or getv?fsstat() when
compiling with debugging disabled only. It was caused by the declaration of a
character array for use with sstrerror() inside a call to DEBUG().

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

src/Makefile.am: Use curl CFLAGS when building the nginx plugin.

Else curl/curl.h cannot be found in non-standard places at build time.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>
Updated the changelog.

Merge branch 'collectd-4.1' into collectd-4.2

Conflicts:

	ChangeLog
	version-gen.sh
Bumped version to 4.1.5; Updated ChangeLog.

sensors plugin: While I was at it I reorganized the code a little so it's easier to read.

For instance I moved the name to type conversion out of the main loop and into
a separate function, likewise the chip to string representation conversion. The
`submit' function is now very careful that all strings are null terminated and
that no buffer overflow may occur.
sensors plugin: Implemented support for libsensors3.
exec plugin: Added the possibility to execute programs upon notifications (EXPERIMENTAL)

src/utils_cache.c: Added the creation of an `OKAY' notification.

It is generated when a value was missing and is received again.
logfile plugin: Added a notification plugin.
src/plugin.c: Notification callbacks were added to the wrong linked list.

src/utils_cache.[ch]: Implemented uc_[gs]et_state to receive and set the state of a value.

This is most likely very buggy. The intention is that this is used in the
threshold module to decide wether or not so send a notification, i. e. if the
problem existed before or not.
src/utils_threshold.h: Documented the public functions.

src/utils_threshold.c: Implemented the new `Persist' option.

The idea is that, if the option is set to `true', many notifications will be
sent, until the problem vanishes again. If set to `false' only one notification
will be sent upon a state change.
This, however, is not implemented yet.

bindings/Makefile.am: Fix a bug that happened when src and build directory are not the same.

Thanks to Michael Tiernan for reporting this bug.
src/utils_threshold.c: Corrected and improved the handling of the `invert' setting.

collectd.conf(5): Wrote some more about the threshold configuration..

..in its current state.
collectd.conf(5): Started documenting the threshold thingy.

utils_{cache,threshold}.[ch]: Implemented the ``check interesting'' function.

The cache now checks if a missing value would be ``interesting'', i. e. if a
threshold is configured for it. If so, a notification is send and the entry is
_not_ removed from the cache. Otherwise, no notification is sent and the entry
is removed.
The changes have been tested a little and should basically work.
Bumped version to 4.2.2; Updated ChangeLog.
Merge branch 'collectd-4.1' into collectd-4.2
Merge branch 'master' of octo@verplant.org:/var/lib/git/collectd

src/utils_cache.[ch]: Added the `uc_check_timeout' function.

This function is called before the read plugins. It checks if values are
missing, i. e. have not been reported for longer than twice their ``interval''.
In this case a notification is created, though this is probably not the final
behavior.
This code is highly experimental.

Merge branch 'collectd-4.2'

Conflicts:

	src/utils_llist.c

src/utils_avltree.[ch]: Change avl_insert to return >0 if the key is already in the tree.

I'd like to be able to tell when avl_insert fails because of a duplicate key as
opposed to when it fails due to out of memory or other condition.

Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

src/utils_avltree.c: Fix avl_get to work as documented.

The documentation in the header file for avl_get states that value may be null,
but the code in the source file asserts otherwise. This patch changes the code
to reflect the documentation.

Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

rc/utils_llist.c: Fix a bug in llist_prepend.

Copy the element to the tail if it's the first element.
collectd.conf(5): Added a note about plugin loading order.
logfile plugin: fix the `Timestamp' configuration option.

nginx plugin: Use strcmp rather than strcpy to compare strings.

I believe I found a typo in nginx.c which prevents collectd with nginx plugin
from working. Collectd segfaults at startup. Here is a tiny patch to correct
the issue. When applied, everything works as expected.

Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>
Merge branch 'master' of octo@verplant.org:/var/lib/git/collectd

src/utils_llist.[ch]: Changed the semantic so module doesn't copy the `key'.

Whilst looking at my implementation of the plugins we've discussed which are
now using dual avl trees, I saw that the utils_llist module would be a more
efficient substitute for the second avl tree. However, it would need to know
its size and would preferably not duplicate and own the key for each item.
Here's a patch which does this. These changes might make it easier for future
plugins to use the linked list for similar purposes, similar to the way the avl
tree does not impose any lifetime on its keys.

Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>
src/plugin.[ch]: Removed the complain functions.
iptables plugin: Removed the `complain' stuff.
apcups plugin: Removed the `complain' stuff.
cpu plugin: Removed the `complain' stuff.
disk plugin: Removed the `complain' stuff.
Merge branch 'ps/reuse'
contrib/network-proxy.py: Added a simply (unicast) proxy for collectd traffic.

ntpd plugin: Added the `ReverseLookups' option to disable reverse lookups.

Thanks to Simon Richter for pointing this out.
Merge branch 'ps/reuse'

network plugin: Fix setsockopt for SO_REUSEADDR since value of loop variable changed


Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>
Merge branch 'ps/reuse'

examples/MyPlugin.pm: Updated for new version of the perl plugin.

 * use Collectd.pm and removed "Collectd::" prefix
 * pass callbacks by name to plugin_register()

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

Unmarked the perl plugin to be experimental.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

collectd-perl(5): Replaced "BUGS" with "CAVEATS" section.

The bugs section is no longer relevant, however, the users should be warned
about some (mostly Perl ithread specific) limitations.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

perl plugin: Fixed a memory leak in pplugin_register_data_set().

The data set definition is copied by plugin_register_data_set() (in plugin.c)
and thus should be freed after it has been passed on to the plugin module.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

collectdmon: Added SIGHUP handler to restart collectd.

This might be useful for init scripts and the like to restart the collectd
process only.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

collectdmon(1): Added manpage for collectdmon.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

collectdmon: Added a small daemon monitoring collectd.

This is a small "wrapper" daemon which starts and monitors the collectd
daemon. If collectd terminates it will automatically be restarted, unless
collectdmon was told to shut it down.

Current features:

 * restarting the daemon
 * logging to syslog
 * detection of quickly, repeatedly respawning processes
   (similar to SysV init)

collectdmon is similar to mysqld_safe.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

network plugin: Set SO_REUSEADDR on socket so multiple listeners can share port

This patch allows other programs to bind same port and process data from clients
not interfering with master collectd server.

Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

src/utils_avltree.h: Improved the documentation.

The `key' argument is not copied and freed automatically. This was
insufficiently documented in the documentation..

logfile plugin: Default to $localstatedir/log/collectd.log instead of STDOUT.

Imho STDOUT is only a useful default during debugging (which should be by far
the less common case ;-). In any other case it might just "pollute" the
messages printed by e.g. the init script.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

collectd.conf(5): Fixed some typos.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

perl plugin: Made global variables available to Perl plugins.

The "let's become magical" commit.

Each global variable (currently hostname_g and interval_g) will be exported by
introducing an equally named Perl variable. Perl's concept of "magic" is used
to create a read/write interface to the C variables (think of the variables as
being tied). This way any changes to the C variables will be immediately
accessible from the Perl plugin and vice versa.
perl plugin: Improved some error messages.

perl plugin: Shut down an ithread if the embedding pthread terminates.

Each ithread object is registered as thread specific data along with a
destructor function. If the embedding pthread terminates the destructor is
called which takes care of cleanly shutting down the appropriate Perl
interpreter and freeing any related resources.

perl plugin: Fixed error in ithread shutdown loop.

Using the sfree() macro, the loop variable was accidentally set to NULL at the
end of the loop, causing the loop to terminate after the first iteration.

perl plugin: Execute END blocks in main thread only.

Each END block is executed during perl_destruct() which happens once for each
ithread. As the number of ithreads are in no way related to any Perl plugins
this is not what we want. Now, each END block is only executed when the main
threads terminates (which happens after any other Perl thread has been shut
down).

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

src/Makefile.am: Add installation directory defines to AM_CPPFLAGS.

Those definitions used to be available when compiling collectd itself only.
However, they should be available to the plugins as well - else, different
paths would be used within different parts of collectd.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

collectd-perl(5): Suggest the usage of -f when enabling the Perl debugger.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

Collectd.pm: Improved error handling of failed callbacks.

If call_by_name() failed, it will be handled the same way as if the callback
returned "false". The $@ variable may now be used by plugins as well to
describe errors in greater detail.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

collectd-perl(5): Updated documenation of plugin_register().

Document the usage of names instead of references to identify callbacks.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

Collectd.pm: Use threads::shared to share @plugins between threads.

The list of plugins has to be common to all threads to be able to (un)register
callbacks after initialization. As threads::shared is not able to share
references to subroutines the callbacks now have to be identified by their
name. Collectd::call_by_name() is used to execute the callbacks.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

perl plugin: Removed newline from debugging output.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

perl plugin: Removed logging calls from call_by_name().

The function might be called from a logging callback resulting in an infinite
loop. Instead the error message is now saved in $@.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

perl plugin: Added Collectd::call_by_name().

This XSUB passes on a function call to a subroutine identified by its name
passed through $Collectd::cb_name. Collectd::call_by_name does not touch the
stack (unless in case of an error), thus any arguments and return values are
kept in place.

This function is meant to be used inside Collectd.pm only.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

Collectd.pm: Removed an unused variable.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

README: Added libperl to the list of dependencies.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

Collectd.pm: Check for ithread support.

Abort if perl has been compiled without ithread support (i.e.
$Config{'useithreads'} is not defined).

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

perl plugin: Added debugging output to display the ithread behavior.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

collectd-perl(5): Fixed a typo.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

collectd2html.pl: Cleaned up Eddy's patch.

 * Use Perl's undef to identify invalid values.
 * Renamed the "host-is" command line option to "host".

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>
Signed-off-by: Florian Forster <octo@huhu.verplant.org>

bindings/Makefile.am: perl/Makefile depends on config.status.

Any configuration changes should be forwarded to the perl bindings. This patch
will cause perl/Makefile to be recreated after a rerun of the configure
script.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>

perl plugin: Added basic multi-threading support.

This patch maps each C thread, which accesses the perl plugin, to an
interpreter based Perl thread. The implementation has been inspired by Perl's
ithreads introduced in version 5.6.0 and should be compatible (as in: can be
used side-by-side) with it. You can use threads::shared to share data
structures between threads of either implementation.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>

perl plugin: Use PERL_NO_GET_CONTEXT.

All Perl_* API functions have been replaced with their unprefixed
counterparts. The currently used Perl interpreter is passed along to each
function requiring access to it. This removes the need to access the global
variable keeping the pointer to the Perl interpreter in most cases but the
entry points into the plugin (i.e. the callbacks registered with collectd).

This prepares the plugin to efficiently support multiple interpreters.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>

configure, perl plugin: Check for ithreads support.

Disable the perl plugin if Perl does not support ithreads (introduced in Perl
5.6). The configure script will check, if USE_ITHREADS has been defined. Also,
the perl plugin won't build if it has not been defined.

Signed-off-by: Sebastian Harl <sh@tokkee.org>

rrdtool plugin: Fix a memory leak..

..in a VERY uncommon/rare case.

name: django-userskins
description: A pluggable Django app for allowing users to pick among a variety of skins for webapps.

commit.message: Fixed typo of ObjectDoesNotExist versus DoesNotExist for error thrown when user doesn't have a SkinPreference object.
Fixed integration with django-compress. It will now work as advertised with django-compress.
Rectifying horrifying word choice in README.

Added support for the USERSKINS_NEVER_ACCESS_DATABASE setting, which uses only cookies for skin preference persistence, and will never hit the database to check if the user has an associated SkinPreference value.
Updated README to explain the overall design of the app.
Renamed README to README.markdown
Added TODO file.
Updated README for using the middleware.
Updated the example project to use the middleware.
Broke the context into a context and a middleware, which is necessary in order to restore the skin cookie if the user deletes their cookies.
Updated README.
Added support for rendering django-compress groups instead of filename.
Update dark skin to make the nav links visible.
Implemented rough version of the 'userskin' template tag, which injects the appropriate CSS for the skin.
Updated urls to include the django dev static server.
Updated context to always inject the "userskins_use_compress" value.
Commented a mistake in context.py

issue.title: Move to syntax dir to be plugin manager friendly
issue.body:
Plugin managers such as Pathogen, Vundle, or Plug will add the cloned
repo to Vim's runtimepath. To make this syntax file work in that
scenario, the script must be under the syntax directory.

name: interfacemd
description: Tools for working with data from molecular dynamics simulations. Trajectory analysis, computational spectroscopy, density plots, distribution functions, atoms/molecules/systems - specializing in aqueous (water) systems made using Amber, Gromacs, and CP2K simulation packages.

commit.message: pre merge with Arcade
Added routines for working with quartz systems/unitcells. Also new analyzer virtual class for working with systems involving an so2, and some routines for mapping nearest neighbors.
New analysis set that performs RDF calculations for element-pair combinations. Also, 2 new Atom:: routines to convert element to string name and string name to element enums.
new routine to map density of nearest neighbors to so2 molecules
removed the setting/unsetting routines from molecules/atoms. Updated the angle-bond-analysis to perform specialized so2 transit analysis
New xtcfile class for reading compressed gromacs trajectories. Also a few new graphics routines for fitting to specific lineshapes, and new lineshape equations in the statisticsmachine.
Removed all traces of the Water System Parameter class. Parameters from the configuration file are now looked up through the water system class.
About to try changing to remove the wsp - WaterSystemParameters altogether
Lots of new graphics routine for dealing with the voigt and lorentzian fitting of SFG spectra. Also some updates to the SFG c++ routines.
New gromacs analyzer MD system (GMXSystem) and the accompanying code for performing the morita 2002/2008 analysis.

Added the PDBSystem class to allow for parsing through pdb files. The parsing of ATOM lines may not be correct. See the pdbsystem.cpp to see the routine used for tearing apart ATOM entries and compare that to the PDB standard entry definition (fixed-width fields/columns). Also added several scripts for working with amber files.
New PDB file parser to make a molecular system from PDB files

analysis routine now has an observer that performs the status output. Also the lookup routine for determining the polarizability from the data file is functioning (well?). Added a new (design-)patterns namespace to encapsulate generic pattern abstract classes for use. Also fine-tuned the graphical output python routines.

Made the structure-analyzer allow for selection of amber of xyz system analyses. Also added the h2o-polarizability data file parser, and coded an atomic density analysis routine. Also created a density plotter to match the atomic density histogram analysis routine.
Fully functioning amber and cp2k sfg (morita 2008) code. As well as a new class set for handling parsing of parameter files
A working set of graphics tools for the SFG data. It looks like all systems are a go for morita2008 treatment

Looks like the results are reasonable. Going to save this spot and test the output to see what the spectra look like. No apparent memory leaks, as well. Cleaned up issues with accessing beyond eigen-matrix bounds.
not much
inlining of eigen matrix routines
nothing new
Removed calls to dgemm (BLAS 3 routine) because it seems to be defunct in MKL 10.2.5.035
reorganized some classes for analysis, and started the switch over to the 2008 morita/ishiyama scheme
Further commenting for doxygen tests

Merge branch 'master' of git@github.com:eshamay/interfacemd into doxygen

Conflicts:
	sfg/morita2002.h
Adding doxygen comments/tags
adding some documentation via doxygen comments

Restructered the way the watersystem, Analyzer, and Analysis sets are made to clean up the main program. Now a default Analyzer will open up the system.cfg file (default name with optional filename parameters), and the only other call to make is send an AnalysisSet to the Analyzer::SystemAnalysis routine. Much prettier.

Introduced AnalysisSet's. These define an analysis to be performed BY an Analyzer. All the analyses are thus more compactly defined by only specifying the setup, analysis, and dataoutput routines (if necessary), and also a description, and filename to use for the analysis.
Also finished up some touches on the previous so2 structural system analyses that were already around from before.
new tcf sfg analyzer plotter
starting new output work on the 2002 sfg routines

2 new classes deriving from a morita 2002 analyzer for dealing specifically with either the amber, or the xyz systems and calculating the SFG data. Also branched the morita H2O molecule class into a separate file.
A lot of refactoring of the code and new namespaces for clarity in utility.h. New scripts in the structure/ for determining bondlengths, angles, etc.
Full migration to the Eigen linear algebra routines for the morita 2002 system analysis. New graphics routines for matplotlib'ing data

Added generic comparison and equality template classes to the md_utility for forming predicates to test against a particular init value or to test equality using a particular class attribute. Now starting work on testing routines to work with xyz data
Updating morita2002 to use the new Eigen tensor routines. Lapack seems to be the fastest routine for solving the local field correction at this time.
two new molecule types

Generalized the parsing routine in the xyz system parsers to parse small/simple molecules really quickly and generally. Also enumerated molecule types to get rid of string comparisons when doing calculations.
Updated the minor issues with the new tensor system, and fixed some function declarations
going through and fixing up all the routines to use the new Eigen library
moved older files into a misc/ directory

Full conversion to the Eigen linear algebra library instead of boost - for faster work with fixed-size and small vectors/matrices. Also, it has a way WAY better API than boost's. Had to rid the entire codebase of std::vectors holding any Eigen objects, though, because of weird incompatibilities. However, the change to VecR lists will probably serve to speed-up the overall computations.

Added an element field to atoms. Refactored all the code to do a comparison of the element (enum/int) instead of the atom's name (string). Since the operation happens SO often, it should be a faster operation using smaller data.

Secondly - added/finished the methods in the graph to determine the closest atom to a given atom or molecule. Also redid the BondedAtoms to return all the hbonds and covalent bonds. Graph now keep ahold of ALL the inter-atomic distances instead of discarding them when parsing. Should create a full set of edges each and every update.
fixed up the bond parsing so that ALL atom pairs get a bond/edge defined in the graph - we're already calculating the distance between them, why not store it in the graph?
working copy to finish stuff locally

fixed up lots of new utilities in the md_utility namespace for processing pairs and names. Also fixed a few problems with molecule parsing in the BondGraph. Created a few exception handlers for detailing the issues related to improper parsing of atoms into molecules.

New distance calculator in the mdsystem to find distances between molecules. Fixed wannier and molecule parsing in the xyzsystem. Created new xyzsfg program to start attacking SFG calculated from XYZ files from cp2k output. The idea is to use the wannier centers to calculate the dipoles accurately, and use the Morita/hynes 2002 technique to get the analytical forms of the polarizabilities. Also a new script to find duplicate timesteps due to restarts of the cp2k runs.
lots! XYZ system nominally working
Added calculation of the FFT of the time-domain morita2002 signal
Completely eliminated utility.h preprocessor calls from all the md-system codes. No more calls to RUN or RUN2! A bug is causing segfaults in the morita2002 code, however

Fully working system - no data output yet. system dipole and polarizability are calculated WITH the local field correction being solved for via LAPACK. Also separated the conversion units into a new sfgunits header file.

name: red
description: Red writes like Ruby and runs like JavaScript.

commit.message: Added Module#define_method.
Fixed error call for unknown methods.
Added rackup's config.ru to .gitignore.
Git tricks.
Fixed issues with arguments checker on singleton method definitions and calls to Proc#call.
Updating to gem version 4.1.7.
Fixed a Safari bug regarding window.__name__.
Eliminated reserved JavaScript keywords from source.
Cleaned up gem files.
Rails plugin now adds public/javascripts/red/lib in addition to public/javascripts/red.
Updated to gem version 4.1.6.
Fixed Rails plugin.
Removed requirement for file "red/version.rb".
Updated to version 4.1.5.
Updated require files.
Updated to gem version 4.1.4.
Updated manifest to include require loadpath files for redshift and redspec.
Updating gem to version 4.1.3.
Restructured require path and source folders.
Got rid of some leftover files from old newgem version.
Updated to latest versions of rake, hoe, and newgem.
Git issues.
Git issues?
Updated to gem version 4.1.1.
Added optional "file" argument to Red.init to enable red-herring to initialize a filepath without hacking in some global variables.
Ignoring Redspec folder.
Fixed Range#each.
Update gem manifest.
removed rspec stubs, added redspec specs
Expanded require load paths to search the current directory for file x, x.red, x.rb, then search the gem source.
Modified .gitignore
github test.
Added superclass to the list of methods included by default in the Ruby source.
Corrected behavior of TrueClass and FalseClass equal? method families.
Quick tweak.
Adapted attr_* family to new non-camelcased Red.
Fixed Object#instance_variables to match new un-camelcased Red.

Eliminated camelcasing in ruby methods and variable names. This will fix Object#send and Object#method, but will cause backwards compatibility problems in Red libraries that use camelcased ruby methods inside backticks.
Excluded Class#new from argument checking in order to prevent having to run the splatten_args process on each call to #new.
Added "debug" mode. Debug mode defaults to false and currently can be activated by running the command line "red" executable with the "-d" option flag.
Added exception raising to undefined methods and local variables as part of future red_debug mode.
Added conditional for future red_debug mode.
Fixed remaining edge cases in argument checking.
Added argument checking for non-Ruby-source methods. Cleaned up code for handling default, splat, and block arguments.
TypeError is raised if superclass is not a Class.
Updated modules now update their includers.
Non-class/non-module constants opened as classes/modules now raise TypeError.
Corrected "for i in obj" loop behavior - now compiles to "obj.each {|i| ... }".
Numeric#chr now returns a wrapped String instead of a JS native string.
Modified Hash#initialize to fix non-block defaults.
Syntax error fixed in Array id methods.
Fixed Array#reverse; no longer reverses destructively.
Added id for Arrays.  Array#__id__, Array#equal?, Array#object_id now work.
Fix for Array#flatten!.
Quick fixes for Array#delete, Array#flatten!, and Proc identity comparison.
Added dynamic string creation to && and || nodes for the sake of operator assignments.
Fixed boolean operators.
Array#* with a string argument now returns a Red string instead of a native string.
Added NilClass#to_proc -> nil, which enables "def x(&block); y(&block); end" to have optional blocks.

Modifying "private" internal properties like "._value" and "._block" to be accessed via ".__value__" and ".__block__".  This could break some functionality in existing projects that access these properties, but can be fixed with a find-and-replace.
:force_return option no longer propagates to every line of a multiline.
Released gem v4.0.6.
Zero-argument implicit receiver method calls now supported.
Added conditional to Object#send to prevent it raising NoMethodError on every call.
Fixed chained boolean operators (|| and &&).
Preventing error on 'Object#send("method_#{foo}")'-type calls.
Wrote Module#=== method for case equality.
Added NameError and NoMethodError in order to raise NoMethodError in Object#send when the sent method doesn't exist.
Added regexp-escaping to String#include? method.
Updated Object#__send__ to match Object#send.
Updated optimization process to include methods called as string or symbol literal arguments to Object#send.
Fixed a typo that was preventing Exception subclasses from inheriting the toString method.
Class#class repaired.  Fixed a problem with Kernel methods that take no arguments.
More reserved word avoidance.
Modified Red.class() to Red.class_() in order to avoid ParseError in Safari.
Fixed an introduced bug in the boolean class inheritance process.
Fixing a problem introduced in Module#append_features and releasing a new gem with the fix.

Merge branch 'master' of git@github.com:jessesielaff/red

Conflicts:

	lib/source/ruby.rb

Refined module and class inclusion and inheritance.  Children now update when their parents update.  Also made some cosmetic changes to internal attributes (e.g. _objectId => __id__).  Scrapped History.txt on account of meh.
Merge branch 'master' of git@github.com:jessesielaff/red
Cosmetic change in Ruby source: _objectId => __id__

Emergency release of gem Version 4.0.3 in light of Ryan Davis's announcement of backwards-incompatible ParseTree 3.0.0. Shouldn't cause too many problems for Red users; I'll make sure to get Red compatible with PT3 as quickly as possible.
Releasing gem Version 4.0.2.
Fixed bugs in send, attr and friends, and in Exception's #toString() native method.  Also added Regexp escaping.
A fix for the fix to the fix.
Releasing gem version 4.0.1.
Adding method to allow direct translation to string with Ruby source included.
Added some more essential internal methods.
Fixing the fix on the namespace issue.
Fixing a namespacing issue with singleton method definitions.
Updated README.txt
Updating error classes.
Version 4.0 released.
Version 4.0 released.
Bug fix: empty regular expressions ('//') no longer throw a syntax error upon conversion.
Added support for Regexp matching.
Bug fix: undef sexp idiosyncracy accounted for.
Added support for Symbol class and symbol literal evaluation.
Deleting old files.
Vast, sweeping changes.  Pretty much every file.
Added support for Ruby 'undef' and 'super'.  Eliminated deprecated errors and illegal nodes.  Various minor fixes here and there.
Added modules and classes to the namespaced constants that Red recognizes.  This plus last commit resolve ticket #4. [#4 status:resolved]
Added Ruby-like namespace degradation for constants.
Bug fix: fixed an accidentally backwards ternary.
Modified check for "insert return before last line of a multiline node" to ignore returns inside procs.
Instructed git to ignore gem's pkg folder.
Added "new Hash()" wrapper to hashes created in Ruby using {}.
Fixed scoping for blocks.
Bug fix: fixed -s option for command line executable.
Changed foo.bar = x to compile to foo.$bar = x. This is a reversion to earlier functionality.
Fixed equality to match Ruby equality. 0 == 0, nil == nil, [] == [], false == false, '' == '', and ne'er the twain shall meet.
Fixed JS boolean coercion to match Ruby.
Bug fix: "unless" conditions are now treated as arguments.
Bug fix: code portions of evaluated strings are now treated as arguments.
Added "var" to block_given? declaration.
Bug fix: when arrays call functions as receivers, they are no longer absorbed into the function arguments.
Bug fix: string escaping of single- and double-quote wrappers.
Moved node files into a separate directory.
Modified handling of if/else bodies.
Updated Defined node so that "defined? foo" returns working JS.

Changed handling of yield: JavaScript "yield" will not be support, yield(args) in Red will instead compile to block(args) and add &block to the argument signature if there is no block argument already.  Other changes: slight modifications to method call arguments, altered list of prerecognized JS classes, eliminated $ prefix in [:property] calls.
Bug fix: old UntilNode reference removed.
Bug fix: Red no longer picks up on every file with a .re* extension in javascripts/red directories.
Updated the manifest for gem deployment.
Updated executable.  -t option improved, methods cleaned up.
Working on module inclusion.
Bug fix: locally assigned variable nodes in for loops no longer throw ArgumentError.
Removed two unused files.
Nodes now inherit from String. Combined build_node and compile_node into a single action. Updated numerous features.
Testing commits to branch.
Bug fix: corrected behavior on increment construction for statements like "foo = bar + 1".
Added class names to constructor function declarations.

Changed condition of vanilla for loops to cache array length. Bug fix: if/else statements inside if conditions and while/until loop conditions now compile as ternary operators. Added "key" as a second keyword to enable object property iteration in for loops.
Bug fix: added parentheses wrapping to Integers that act as receivers.
Added support for direct-to-JavaScript uninterpreted strings using backticks.
Updating version number to 3.5.0 following gem deployment.
Added support for child classes. Adding now - could cause bugs down the road.  Should be easily fixable if so.

Changed "call to returned function" method to "_".  Bug fixes: 1) added parentheses wrapping to sugared operators ('+', '-', '&&', '||', etc) to fix problems when chaining methods. 2) One more tweak to fixing string eval inside bracket calls.
Merge branch 'master' of git@github.com:jessesielaff/red
Bug fix: String quoting is no longer mishandled in foo["eval#{string}"]-type calls.
Bug fix: Prototype class variables in constructible classes now separate out into an Object.extend declaration.
Updating version number to 3.4.2 following gem deployment.
Added Prototype-style class creation. Fixed bug with reduplicated "this" on @instance_variable, introduced with addition of increment operators.
Updated version number to 3.4.1 following gem deployment.
Edited output message for -u and -r executable options.
Updated version number to 3.4.0 following gem deployment.
Got rid of website generator in gem deployment.
Increased usefulness of -r and -u options by subsuming -r into -u, by adding "overwrite [yN]?" alerts, and by creating all necessary folders for each option.
Added functionality for class << obj, where @@my_var within the block now prepends the value of obj (e.g. obj.my_var)
Bug fix: all_CAPS identifier names now camelcase correctly (e.g. allCAPS)
Bug fix: nested ternary operators now render correctly.
Added <= and >= to list of sugared Ruby operators.
Two fixes: 1) Added increment behavior; foo += 1 and foo -= 1 now return foo++ and foo--. 2) Eliminated "var" declaration from class variable operator assignments.
Bug fix: variables in all-caps with $/@/@@ prefixes no longer keep the prefix upon compiling.
Added "var" as a special method call.  "var(foo)" now returns "var foo".
Bug fix: "var" declaration is now disabled inside while/until condition expressions.
Bug fix: assigning string values to attributes no longer results in stripped quotes.
Removing website generation from gem deployment task.
Updated version number to 3.3.0 following gem deployment.
Added -u command line option for the "red" executable. Installs unobtrusive JavaScript files.
Updated version number to 3.2.1 following gem deployment.
Fixed the handling of class variables within standard class definitions.

Never mind all that.  Github reads README.txt first no matter what; README.txt is necessary for gem deployment.  README.rdoc is going away; github front page will have to be ugly. See the wiki or the docs page for pretty markup.
Oh fie.  Rubyforge docs and github docs render differently based on the same file.  Adding README.txt and altering README.rdoc to work with github.
Removing README.txt.  The .txt file is required for gem deployment, but interferes with github's rdoc display.  To deploy the gem, I'll temporarily rename .rdoc to .txt.
Added rdoc-style READMEs.
Updated version number to 3.2.0.
Added Rails support. Also added commenting for inline JavaScript errors.
Relocated terminal output messages into a new file.  Rescued the error thrown when no argument is given on -s option flag.

Added support for Ruby string conversion from the command line using -s option flag.
Rescued the error thrown when an invalid option flag is used.
Trying to tag as gem release 3.1.0.
Added "red" executable and removed rake task. Tagging as gem release 3.1.0.
Added url for Google group to gem post-install instructions.
Fixed a "FIXME" in the README.
Fixed a "FIXME" in the README.
Adding library files. Contains gem builder materials from Dr Nic Williams' newgem.
Initial commit
